Datatable.LocalizationPair: Experienced farmers are able to better cultivate the Food grown from existing terrain.
Move swift as the Wind and closely-formed as the Wood. Attack like the Fire and be still as the Mountain.
During the many years spent underground, Vaulters educated their citizens with vast amounts of knowledge stored in libraries in hopes to prepare them when it was time to resurface.

All of the great leaders have had one characteristic in common: it was the willingness to confront unequivocally the major anxiety of their people in their time. This, and not much else, is the essence of leadership.
Not many can claim a history rich of lore and prestige. However, the blood of the Drakken runs deep far beyond any other civilization and with it carries great respect.
Having the right connections can noticeably decrease the cost of buyouts.
Speed is the essence of war. Take advantage of the enemy when unprepared, travel by unexpected routes and strike where there are no precautions.
Love for adventure and discovery has led the people to reach places no others have achieved.
A keen eye may reveal what most may not have seen.
Understanding and learning from the Delvers amazing craftsmanship allows for impressive structures.
Hastily constructed walls may not be the best form of defence.
Untrained armies tend to falter in the heat of battle.
Fear of the unknown can make the populous unhappy.
Trade is unwelcome and gates shut to traders.
Sellswords and foreign militants are frowned upon thus making mercenaries less motivated to perform.
Lowered city and district maximum level.
Changing the focus of the training regime can lead to the increase of offensive capabilities at the cost of survivability.
Changing the focus of the training regime can lead to the increase of survivability at the cost of offensive capabilities.
Ordering the mass construction of factories significantly increases productivity at the cost of polluting agriculture.
Blessed with brilliant scientists and geniuses, Science has become the main aspiration for the people while the Industry are for underachievers.
The devotion of the Cultists knows no bounds and fervent worshippers of the Queen place religion before their own lives as their bodies frail from endless hours of worship.
Wealth and trade are the backbone of the Empire. Peace and prosperity is preferred over war.
Born and bred of war, soldiers begin their training at a early age. Destined to be great warriors, they pride their armies over their economy.
Allowing illegal trades and black markets in your cities will bring in extra revenue at the cost of crime and unhappiness.
